record.title: PERMISSION TO REDUCE TIME FOR ELECTRONIC VOTING DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3093
record.narrative:
PERMISSION TO REDUCE TIME FOR ELECTRONIC VOTING DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3093 -- (House of Representatives - July 25, 2007)

[Page: H8457]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, I ask unanimous consent that, during consideration of H.R. 3093 pursuant to House Resolution 562, the Chair may reduce to 2 minutes the minimum time for electronic voting under clause 6 of rule XVIII and clauses 8 and 9 of rule XX.

record.chair: Is there objection to the request of the gentleman from West Virginia?

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, I ask unanimous consent that reduced-time voting in the Committee of the Whole may span the intervention of a rising of the Committee for the administration of the oath of office to a Representative-elect in the House.

record.chair: Is there objection to the request of the gentleman from West Virginia?
Members are advised that the 2-minute voting authority just granted may be applied to questions already postponed.
